main event: A single unidentified object was sighted moving with vertical motions in Washington, D.C. on 3 September 1956.
interesting points: Object observed at arm's length and estimated to be the size of a button to a small pea., The sighting lasted for approximately two minutes., The observer suspected temperature inversion as a possible explanation for the sighting., The object was reported to have no appendages and emitted no sound., Weather conditions included a slight overcast with visibility of 12 miles.
witness description: An observer who reported the sighting in an otherwise starless sky.
